_header: Vices be wild and virtues lame
Subjects: abuses of the age; carols, of complaint
_description: A song on the Abuses of the Age — six quatrains (aaab) plus burden (bb): ‘God þat sittith in trinite / Amend this world yf thy will be’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Vycyce be wyld & vertues lame& now be vicyce turned to
                    game…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…To send love & peace among vs allA mong all men in
                    christente
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 96-7.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 257-8; 1977, 228.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Vices be wyld & vertues lame& vice is torned in to
                    game…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…To send love & grace a monge vs allAnd amonge all men in
                    CristynteExplicit
